tutorial.title: Shopping Cart
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your knowledge of dynamically adding and removing array elements to move items from a wish list into a shopping cart

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use our knowledge of dynamically adding and removing array elements to move items from a wish list into a shopping cart.

Take a look at our wish list items, currently stored in the `wishlist` array. We need to create a new array to store items we'd like to move to the cart.

1. Create a `const` variable named `cart`. Set its value to an empty array.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now remove an item from `wishlist` and store it in a variable.

1. To store the item we'll remove from `wishlist`, create the `let` variable `item1`.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: `let` can be used to create variables like this. `let <variableName>;`

executableContent.instructions:
Time to remove the last element!

1. Use an array method to remove the last element from the `wishlist` array, and save it to the variable `item1`.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: The array method `pop()` is used to remove the last element of an array.

executableContent.instructions:
We will repeat the same process for the second item.

1. Create a `const` variable named `item2` to store the next item we'll remove from the wish list.
2. Remove `headphones` using an array method, and save its value in `item2`.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Now that we have removed items from the `wishlist`, we need to add them to the `cart`.

1. Use an array method to add both `item1` and `item2` to the cart array.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: The array method `push()` is used to add elements to an array.

executableContent.instructions:
After having items in our cart, we need to check out the items.

1. To view the prices of the items in the cart, display `"Cart prices:"` in the console.
2. On the next line, display the `cart` array in the console.

files.name: script.js

executableContent.instructions:
Let's calculate the total price.

1. Create a `const` variable named `total` set to `item1` *plus* `item2`.

files.name: script.js

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Use the addition operator ( `+` ) to add two variables.

executableContent.instructions:
Let the user know how much they'll have to pay.

1. In the console display `"Total: "` followed by the `total` variable, in a single line.

files.name: script.js
